API Reference¶

This page documents the public API of bittr-tess-vetter.

The recommended import pattern is:

import bittr_tess_vetter.api as btv

Contents

  • Core Types

    • Transit Fitting Types

    • Activity Types

  • Main Entry Point

  • Periodogram and Detection

  • Vetting Checks

    • LC-Only Checks (V01-V05)

    • Catalog Checks (V06-V07)

    • Pixel Checks (V08-V10)

    • Exovetter Checks (V11-V12)

  • Pixel Localization

  • Transit Fitting (v3)

  • Timing Analysis (v3)

    • TTV Track Search

  • Activity Characterization (v3)

  • Transit Recovery (v3)

  • PRF and Pixel Modeling

  • False Positive Probability

  • Ephemeris Matching

  • Transit Masks and Utilities

    • Prefilters

    • Cadence and Aperture

  • Evidence and Provenance

  • Utilities

  • MLX Acceleration (Optional)

Core Types¶

Data containers and type definitions used throughout the API.

Ephemeris

Transit ephemeris parameters.

LightCurve

Simplified light curve container for API use.

StellarParams

alias of StellarParameters

CheckResult

Result of a single vetting check.

Candidate

Transit candidate container for vetting.

TPFStamp

Target Pixel File data container (array-only, no FITS I/O).

VettingBundleResult

Structured output from the vetting orchestrator.

Transit Fitting Types¶

TransitFitResult

Result of physical transit model fit.

TransitTime

Single transit timing measurement.

TTVResult

Transit timing variation analysis summary.

OddEvenResult

Odd/even depth comparison result for eclipsing binary vetting.

TrapezoidFit

Trapezoid model fit result.

StackedTransit

Stacked transit light curve.

RecoveryResult

Transit recovery result from active star.

Activity Types¶

ActivityResult

Comprehensive stellar activity characterization.

Flare

Single flare event detection.

Main Entry Point¶

The primary orchestration function for running the complete vetting pipeline.

vet_candidate

Run a complete vetting pipeline on a transit candidate.

Aliases:

  • btv.vet is an alias for vet_candidate

Periodogram and Detection¶

Functions for transit detection and periodogram analysis.

run_periodogram

Host-facing wrapper for periodogram analysis.

auto_periodogram

Automatically compute periodogram with optimal settings.

ls_periodogram

Compute Lomb-Scargle periodogram.

tls_search

Single TLS search.

tls_search_per_sector

TLS search with per-sector strategy for multi-sector data.

search_planets

Iterative multi-planet search using TLS.

refine_period

Refine a period estimate with a constrained TLS search.

compute_transit_model

Compute a simple box transit model and fit diagnostics.

compute_bls_model

Compute BLS box model for given parameters.

detect_sector_gaps

Find indices where gaps > threshold indicate sector boundaries.

split_by_sectors

Split light curve arrays at sector boundaries.

merge_candidates

Merge candidates from multiple sectors, deduplicate by period.

Types:

PerformancePreset

PeriodogramPeak

Individual peak from periodogram analysis.

PeriodogramResult

Complete periodogram analysis result.

Aliases:

  • btv.periodogram is an alias for run_periodogram

Vetting Checks¶

LC-Only Checks (V01-V05)¶

Light curve-only vetting checks that do not require external data.

odd_even_depth

V01: Compare depth of odd vs even transits.

secondary_eclipse

V02: Search for secondary eclipse at phase 0.5.

duration_consistency

V03: Check transit duration vs stellar density expectation.

depth_stability

V04: Check depth consistency across individual transits.

v_shape

V05: Distinguish U-shaped (planet) vs V-shaped (grazing EB) transits.

vet_lc_only

Run all LC-only vetting checks (V01-V05).

Catalog Checks (V06-V07)¶

Checks that query external catalogs (require network=True).

nearby_eb_search

V06: Search for known eclipsing binaries near target.

exofop_disposition

V07: Look up the ExoFOP-TESS TOI table row for a TIC.

vet_catalog

Run catalog vetting checks (V06-V07).

Pixel Checks (V08-V10)¶

Pixel-level vetting checks.

centroid_shift

V08: Detect centroid motion during transit.

difference_image_localization

V09: Locate transit source via pixel-level light curve analysis.

aperture_dependence

V10: Check if transit depth varies with aperture size.

vet_pixel

Run all pixel-level vetting checks (V08-V10).

Exovetter Checks (V11-V12)¶

Integration with the Exovetter package.

modshift

V11: ModShift test for secondary eclipse detection at arbitrary phase.

sweet

V12: SWEET test for stellar variability masquerading as transits.

vet_exovetter

Run all exovetter checks (V11-V12).

Pixel Localization¶

WCS-aware localization and pixel analysis tools.

localize_transit_source

Localize the transit source using WCS-aware difference imaging.

localize_transit_host_single_sector

localize_transit_host_single_sector_with_baseline_check

localize_transit_host_multi_sector

Localize the transit host across multiple sectors and build a consensus.

compute_aperture_family_depth_curve

Compute transit depth as a function of aperture size.

generate_pixel_vet_report

Generate a PixelVetReport bundling available pixel diagnostics.

Types:

LocalizationResult

WCS-aware localization result with uncertainty quantification.

LocalizationVerdict

Machine-readable localization verdict.

ReferenceSource

Reference sky position used for host-hypothesis localization.

LocalizationDiagnostics

alias of LocalizationDiagnosticsResult

LocalizationImages

dict() -> new empty dictionary dict(mapping) -> new dictionary initialized from a mapping object's (key, value) pairs dict(iterable) -> new dictionary initialized as if via: d = {} for k, v in iterable: d[k] = v dict(**kwargs) -> new dictionary initialized with the name=value pairs in the keyword argument list. For example: dict(one=1, two=2).

TransitParams

Parameters describing a transit signal.

ApertureFamilyResult

Result from aperture family depth curve analysis.

PixelVetReport

Bundle of pixel-level diagnostics (no policy).

Aliases:

  • btv.localize is an alias for localize_transit_source

  • btv.aperture_family_depth_curve is an alias for compute_aperture_family_depth_curve

Transit Fitting (v3)¶

Physical transit model fitting using batman.

fit_transit

Fit physical transit model using batman.

quick_estimate

Analytic initial guesses for transit parameters.

Timing Analysis (v3)¶

Transit timing measurements and TTV analysis.

measure_transit_times

Measure mid-transit times for all observable transits.

analyze_ttvs

Compute O-C residuals and TTV statistics.

TTV Track Search¶

run_ttv_track_search

Run a TTV track search around a known ephemeris.

run_ttv_track_search_for_candidate

Run TTV track search using a Candidate's ephemeris.

estimate_search_cost

identify_observing_windows

should_run_ttv_search

Types:

TTVSearchBudget

Budget controls for TTV track search.

TTVTrackSearchResult

Full result from a TTV track search.

Activity Characterization (v3)¶

Stellar activity analysis and flare detection.

characterize_activity

Characterize stellar activity from light curve.

mask_flares

Replace flare regions with interpolated baseline.

Transit Recovery (v3)¶

Signal recovery for active stars.

recover_transit

Recover transit signal from active star.

recover_transit_timeseries

Recover a known transit signal by removing stellar variability and stacking transits.

detrend

Detrend light curve while preserving transits.

stack_transits

Phase-fold and stack all transits.

PRF and Pixel Modeling¶

Point Response Function modeling for pixel-level analysis.

build_prf_model

Build a 2D Gaussian PSF model centered at given pixel coordinates.

build_prf_model_at_pixels

Build a 2D Gaussian PSF model evaluated at specific pixel coordinates.

evaluate_prf_weights

Evaluate the flux fraction captured within an aperture mask.

get_prf_model

Get a PRF model instance.

score_hypotheses_prf_lite

Score source hypotheses by fitting PRF-lite models to a difference image.

score_hypotheses_with_prf

Score source hypotheses using specified PRF backend.

fit_aperture_hypothesis

Fit aperture depth curves to identify the transit host.

aggregate_multi_sector

Aggregate per-sector hypothesis rankings into a multi-sector consensus.

Types:

PRFParams

Parameters for a PRF/PSF model.

PRFFitResult

Result of fitting a PRF/PSF model to image data.

BackgroundParams

Background gradient parameters.

PRFModel

Protocol for PRF/PSF models.

PRFBackend

alias of Literal['prf_lite', 'parametric', 'instrument']

HypothesisScore

Per-hypothesis scoring result from PRF-based fitting.

MultiSectorConsensus

Result of aggregating per-sector hypothesis rankings.

ApertureHypothesisFit

Result of aperture-based host hypothesis testing.

AperturePrediction

Predicted depth-vs-aperture curve for a hypothesis.

ApertureConflict

Detected conflict between localization and aperture evidence.

False Positive Probability¶

FPP estimation using TRICERATOPS+.

calculate_fpp

Calculate FPP using TRICERATOPS+ with an explicit preset.

Types:

TriceratopsFppPreset

Controls tradeoffs between runtime, stability, and fidelity.

FAST_PRESET

Controls tradeoffs between runtime, stability, and fidelity.

STANDARD_PRESET

Controls tradeoffs between runtime, stability, and fidelity.

Ephemeris Matching¶

Tools for matching ephemerides across catalogs.

run_ephemeris_matching

Run full ephemeris matching for a candidate.

build_index_from_csv

Build ephemeris index from a CSV file.

compute_match_score

Compute match score from residuals (higher is better, 0-1].

compute_harmonic_match

Check for harmonic relationship between query and entry ephemerides.

classify_matches

Classify matches and return best match.

load_index

Load ephemeris index from a JSON file.

save_index

Save ephemeris index to a JSON file.

wrap_t0

Wrap t0 to [0, period) relative to a reference epoch.

Types:

EphemerisEntry

An entry in the ephemeris index.

EphemerisIndex

Searchable ephemeris index with harmonic support.

EphemerisMatch

A match result from the ephemeris index.

EphemerisMatchResult

Full match result for a candidate.

MatchClass

alias of Literal['EPHEMERIS_MATCH_STRONG', 'EPHEMERIS_MATCH_WEAK', 'NONE']

Transit Masks and Utilities¶

Helper functions for transit analysis.

get_in_transit_mask

Get boolean mask for in-transit points.

get_out_of_transit_mask

Get boolean mask for out-of-transit points.

get_out_of_transit_mask_windowed

Out-of-transit mask with a local window around each transit.

get_odd_even_transit_indices

Get transit orbit numbers for each time point (odd/even).

measure_transit_depth

Measure transit depth from in/out-of-transit flux.

count_transits

Count the number of observable transits in the data.

odd_even_result

Compute odd/even depth comparison for eclipsing binary detection.

Prefilters¶

compute_depth_over_depth_err_snr

compute_phase_coverage

Cadence and Aperture¶

default_cadence_mask

Return a conservative cadence mask for pixel-level computations.

create_circular_aperture_mask

Create a circular aperture mask.

Evidence and Provenance¶

Tools for evidence serialization and provenance tracking.

checks_to_evidence_items

Convert CheckResult objects to JSON-serializable evidence-like dicts.

EvidenceEnvelope

A JSON-friendly envelope for an evidence product.

EvidenceProvenance

Provenance for an evidence product.

compute_evidence_code_hash

Compute a best-effort code identifier for provenance.

load_evidence

save_evidence

Utilities¶

General utility functions and constants.

cap_top_k

Truncate list to max_items, log warning if truncated.

cap_neighbors

Truncate neighbor list, log warning if truncated.

cap_plots

Truncate plot list, log warning if truncated.

cap_variant_summaries

Truncate variant summaries, log warning if truncated.

check_tolerance

Check if a replayed value is within tolerance of the original.

Types:

ToleranceResult

Result of a tolerance check between original and replayed values.

Constants:

  • DEFAULT_TOP_K_CAP

  • DEFAULT_VARIANT_SUMMARIES_CAP

  • DEFAULT_NEIGHBORS_CAP

  • DEFAULT_PLOTS_CAP

  • HARMONIC_RATIOS

  • MLX_AVAILABLE

MLX Acceleration (Optional)¶

GPU-accelerated functions for Apple Silicon (requires MLX).

These functions are only available when MLX_AVAILABLE is True.

smooth_box_template

score_fixed_period

score_fixed_period_refine_t0

score_top_k_periods

integrated_gradients

Types:

MlxTopKScoreResult

Result of scoring a small set of candidate periods.

MlxT0RefinementResult

Result of local t0 refinement for a fixed-period MLX score.
